previous.title: What Should My Image Look Like?

contents.content:
Now it’s your turn to answer a scientific question by creating your own color image of the cosmos and exploring what it reveals. In this investigation you have learned how to:

  • Look through a dusty nebula to see what’s inside
  • Search for a faraway galaxy
  • Locate the hot young stars in a galaxy
  • Identify star-forming regions in a galaxy

Think about these points before you begin:

  • What question do you want to answer? (You can design your own question here or explore an option listed above.)
  • What types of objects would you look at to investigate your question?
  • What filters will be most appropriate for conducting your investigation? Why? (You don’t have to use all the filters.)
  • What colors do you want to use for your chromatic ordering sequence and which color will you assign to each filter?
Record some of your ideas and then go to the next page to explore the available images and filters.
